item.description:
This is one in a series of presentations that Phillip Werner, a co-organizer with the random group, will be making this summer.

Philip is a dynamic outdoor adventure speaker and photographer with over 20 years of public speaking experience to audiences of all a sizes. His past talks have covered hiking and winter mountaineering in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, Hiking the Appalachian Trail and Vermont’s Long Trail, Backpacking Coast-to-Coast across Scotland, Gear Demonstrations on Lightweight and Ultralight Backpacking, and Backpacking for Boy Scouts.

While you can use this event listing to coordinate with other randomites you should call the number listed for the event to get more information or to register

=====

  • November 3, 2011. Hiking the White Mountain 4000 Footers, 6:00 p.m. – 7:30 p.m, EMS Harvard Square, 1 Brattle St., 2nd Floor, Cambridge, MA 02138. Call (617) 864-2061 for more information. Attendance is Free.

    If you're interested in taking your day hiking skills to the next level, climbing all 48 mountains on the White Mountain 4000 footer list is an exciting undertaking and an excellent way for hikers of all ages to learn new outdoor skills. It doesn't matter how old you are or whether you're in shape or not, anyone can climb these peaks with a little inspiration and perseverance. In this talk, Philip Werner will give an overview of the 4000 footer peaks, explain the gear and skills you need to learn, and discuss several different strategies for climbing them.
item.name: Hiking the White Mountain 4000 Footers (Educational Series)
